lines.text: We'll have seven children and a million pounds a year.
What was that?
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: I was thinking when we were children. You've forgotten.
Shouldn't I share your thoughts?
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: We shall always be in love, won't we?
Always.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: Even when we're old?
Even when we're old.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text:
[very curious]
Proutie, who was Lark?
She was old Mr. Dane's ward, miss.
Uncle Rollo's ward?
Oh, dear, no, Miss Lark was Mr. Rollo's father's ward, miss. She grew up with Mr. Rollo and all the Dane children.
And you were here even then?
Oh, yes, miss. My old auntie was in service with Mr. Rollo's father. I remember Miss Lark well. One doesn't forget Miss Lark.
[changing the subject]
Dinner will be served at 7.00 miss. The General likes to dress.
Good. It'll be a pleasant change, we're allowed to be feminine off-duty. Proutie, you haven't told me what happened to Lark.
Nothing happened to her, miss.
I used to play hide and seek in these rooms.
How interesting since you never set foot here before.
Imaginary hide and seek. When I was little my aunt taught me where every room was. She wanted to know this house as she remembered it, she grew up here.
Was your aunt by any chance called Lark?
Yes, Lark Ingoldsby. I was brought up by her. She made me promise to visit this house if I ever got to London.
You begin to make sense.

[singing]
"I'll list for my soldier/And follow my love..."

[interrupting]
Now I know why they call you "Lark".
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text:
[turning around]
Were you there? Listening all the time?
You've grown up.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: A little.
I didn't know you could sing like that.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: You didn't know I was growing up either.
Do you know what happened to this room?
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: No.
It's full of light, sunshine and flowers.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: You'll listen to reason, not to me. The Danes have always listened to the reasons instead of their hearts.
Let's not get angry.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: I am not angry, I'm lost. Pelham is in love with me. I can't stay here and hurt him.
Pelham?
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: Selina knows that if you go without me I must leave this house, too. I can't wait for you, Rollo!
General Sir Roland Dane.
No. If I have to choose between my army career and Lark. I know which I want. I want Lark!
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: You can't mean that.
Believe me, I do.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text:
[to Selina]
As long as I am in this house. This is my room.
[shouts]
Get out of it!
I sent him away.

Then if I were you, I'd go and find him. Don't cheat yourself of love the way I did. Listen to me! Don't stop to bargain for happiness, for in one wasted moment, a door may close, a ship may sail, a train may leave, a man may die. Go after him or make your mind you'll never see him again.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo

lines.text: There's no such thing as an empty room.
lines.character: General Sir Roland Dane a.k.a Rollo
